title: Arsene Wenger may be forced to sit with Chelsea fans when Arsenal travel to Stamford Bridge on Saturday
text:

Arsene Wenger may have to sit with Chelsea fans during Saturday’s London derby at Stamford Bridge. 
Wenger will be serving the third of a four game touchline ban and cannot sit in the directors’ box as it is on the other side of the ground to the dressing rooms. 
Arsenal boss Wenger is still allowed to give a team talk before the game and at half time so wants easy access and is likely to sit in the middle tier of the East Stand. Read More Cesc Fabregas hails Arsenal and Arsene Wenger for giving him 'everything' ahead of Chelsea's Gunners showdown The Gunners boss has been in the stands for the past two games after picking up the touchline ban (Photo: REUTERS) He had a bird's eye view of Arsenal's defeat against Watford, which was not received well by Gunners fans (Photo: REUTERS) 
But Mirror Sport understands that under Premier League rules every club has to reserve two seats for the away team for this sort of eventuality and Wenger will be in among what are described as executive seats with well heeled supporters. 
Chelsea are also laying on stewards and Arsenal are bringing their own security after lengthy discussions between the clubs to try and make it as easy as possible. Read More
